qas.question: What caused a delay in the production of high quality records?
On what date was the 12 inch LP released?
In what city was the 12 in LP released?
How long did it take Columbia to produce a consumer friendly long play record?

context: Beginning in 1939, Dr. Peter Goldmark and his staff at Columbia Records and at CBS Laboratories undertook efforts to address problems of recording and playing back narrow grooves and developing an inexpensive, reliable consumer playback system. It took <a4_0>about eight years<a4_0/> of study, except when it was suspended because of <a0_0>World War II<a0_0/>. Finally, the 12-inch (30 cm) Long Play (LP) 33 1⁄3 rpm microgroove record album was introduced by the <a1_0>Columbia Record Company<a1_0/> at a <a3_0>New York<a3_0/> press conference on <a2_0>June 18, 1948<a2_0/>.
